unnormalised: Someone asked me about the best way to travel within India using roadways, and tbh, it really depends on where you're headed and your budget. But here's a quick rundown based on my experiences.
normalised: Someone asked me about the best way to travel within India using roadways, and to be honest, it really depends on where you are headed and your budget. But here is a quick rundown based on my experiences.

unnormalised: For shorter distances, state transport buses are usually the cheapest option. I've taken many a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus from Pune to Mumbai – costs around Rs. 500 and takes about 4 hrs, give or take. Private buses are a bit more comfy, maybe Rs. 800-Rs. 1200 for the same route. For longer routes, look at Volvo or Scania buses. They're pricier, but you get AC, reclining seats, and maybe even a movie! Remember to book in advance, especially during Diwali or other festivals. RedBus or similar apps are your friends.
normalised: For shorter distances, state transport buses are usually the cheapest option. I have taken many a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (M-S-R-T-C) bus from Pune to Mumbai – costs around rupee five hundred and takes about four hours, give or take. Private buses are a bit more comfy, maybe rupee eight hundred to rupee one thousand two hundred for the same route. For longer routes, look at Volvo or Scania buses. They are pricier, but you get A-C, reclining seats, and maybe even a movie! Remember to book in advance, especially during Diwali or other festivals. RedBus or similar applications are your friends.

unnormalised: Driving yourself is great for flexibility, but India's roads can be... interesting. From Mumbai to Goa, it's a scenic drive, but be prepared for toll booths and varying road conditions. Total distance is approx. 600 km. A lot of folks also rent cars or hire a driver. This can be a good middle ground if you want some control but don't want the hassle of driving the whole way. Just ensure your driver has a valid license and knows the route. Safe travels, bhai!
